content: this functions as a fake first single_crochet double_crochet then 1 single_crochet double_crochet in the next 9 double_crochet treble_crochet of the previous row * chain 1 crochet 1 double_crochet treble_crochet in each 10 single_crochet double_crochet of the previous row chain 1 crochet 1 single_crochet double_crochet in each 10 double_crochet treble_crochet of the previous row repeat from * to end of row row 3 you do 10 of the same stitches in the stitches of the previous row in other words 1 double_crochet treble_crochet in each of the ten double_crochet treble_crochet in the previous row - or 1 single_crochet double_crochet in each of the ten single_crochet double_crochet in the previous row but don t forget to do your chain stitch between each group of ten stitches - this allows for the difference in height between the stitches if you don t do it your work will curl c olivia rainsford 2010 www gingerbreadadventures com and so you continue after a single row in the starting colour two row in each new colour here you can see i m starting my fourth row in white doing 1 double_crochet treble_crochet in each of the 10 single_crochet double_crochet of the previous row and on it goes up and down the blanket till it has reached the desired width you finish by doing just one row in your finishing colour this gives it an even edge you can then do a single row of double_crochet treble_crochet or single_crochet double_crochet around the afghan to make it neat after a few row the pattern clearly emerges you may not reproduce this pattern in print or claim it as your work you may not sell the pattern do not copy and paste pattern to another website please use a link c olivia rainsford 2010 www gingerbreadadventures com
